info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 24 at 7:25PM CDT until October 24 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Mason, McCulloch and San Saba.
* WHEN...Until 1030 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 723 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms, from Brady to Richland Springs and San Saba, moving east at 35 mph. These storms were developing south into northern Mason county. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brady, San Saba, Mason, Richland Springs, Algerita, Cherokee, Voca, Fredonia, Pontotoc, Camp San Saba, Katemcy, Sloan, Camp Air, Rochelle, Art, Placid, Brady Lake, Grit, Skeeterville and Hedwigs Hill. - People attending Richland Springs Coyote Field and Rochelle Hornet Pride Stadium should seek shelter immediately.
This includes the following Low Water Crossings... White Street at Live Oak Creek, South Blackburn between Adkins and 13th, 17th Street between Pine and College, Hallum Draw, FM 1851 crossing Tiger Creek, South High between 14th and 15th Streets, FM 1121 crossing Onion Creek, FM 1028 crossing Corn Creek, FM 1030 crossing Wallace Creek and County Road 120 crossing East Cow Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: McCulloch, TX; Mason, TX; San Saba, TX
